item.title: Reverse engineering thermal printers
item.description: A significant part of my current work involves dealing with thermal printers to print receipts, invoices, item slips etc ..; For those unfamiliar. I’m talking about those usually small cashier side printers that print your receipts when you buy something from a restaurant, or any other shop. Thermal printers use a universal protocol to send/receive printing commands. This protocol is called ESC/POS. For anyone stumbling on to this post trying to figure-out what the heck is going on with those printers, I feel you.
